forensic.name: Excavator
forensic.desc:
Author: Rxxxf

During incident response, a core dump was recovered from a crashed binary that appeared to be staging a configuration file. The team managed to grab the dump, but it was partially corrupted during extraction.
Your task: carve through the damaged core and recover the malware’s config file.

forensic.name: HBH
forensic.desc:
I said it all ..

author: fatima

forensic.name: Hart
forensic.desc:
Authors: fatima

My industrial sensor network has been compromised , can u figure out what the attacker is hiding .

forensic.name: Laurels
Package Delivery
forensic.desc:
Authors: Rxxxf x letmewin

Our production server was hacked and the breach is still unknown. The SOC only preserved a snapshot taken during the attacker’s enumeration phase.
You get a logical disk image of the host and a copy of the captured network evidence (the password will reveal itself). Piece together what happened, follow the trail, and recover the stolen data.
Note: We relied on an intern to deploy our system, so expect a mess ...

Link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ogO0Z8Ke6pBz4e3CHTUB9imb0r9ZmBxR/view?usp=sharing

forensic.name: Poor Yooz
forensic.desc:
Author: bnd

Poor Yooz, his only mistake is that he can't remember things very well!!

Useful timeline for the investigation:

Suspicious network traffic was detected
The employee, Ree Yooz, was disconneceted from his workstation session
The packet capture was stopped and saved. Further suspicous network traffic was noticed after that
A memory dump of the workstation has been taken
The flag is in two parts.
Flag format: shellmates{part1part2}

link: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ww7DIElL9uI65fP4B_79KWOIC17Ai0Ob?usp=drive_link
